title: [$250] Receipt gets lost and transaction type returns to cash after editing split.

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.34-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @mukhrr **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Open Source](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C01GTK53T8Q/p1760859140008749) ## Action Performed: Precondition: Have card transactions created 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Go to a card transaction 3. Split it and save 4. Click to one of split expense 5. Click Edit split 6. Add one more split and make sure to match total of all splits 7. Click Save ## Expected Result: All transactions in report should have a receipt and card icon/text ## Actual Result: Only some (previously touched: added and subtracted) transactions have receipt and card icon/text. The rest defaults to cash and no receipt Refreshing page makes it correct ## Workaround: Refreshing page makes it correct ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
Platforms Tested: On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Login with new account 3. Go offline ( Use developer network tool to go offline ) 4. Click plus icon - Create expense - Scan 5. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat 3. Create two expenses in the workspace chat 4. Open the expense report 5. Go offline 6. Open any expense thread 7. Click More > Delete 8. Delete the expense 9. Open the remaining expense 10. Click arrow button on the RHP ## Expected Result: Arrow button should be disabled and not open the deleted expense ## Actual Result: Arrow button is not disabled and it opens the deleted expense ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop
